properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 3:09PM EST until January 16 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Burlington VT
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30
mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero.

* WHERE...Eastern Clinton County.

* WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 11 PM this evening
to 7 PM EST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 4 AM
to 10 AM EST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult later tonight,
especially for the morning commute. Areas of blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility Thursday afternoon. The cold
wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little
as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the warning area later
tonight and become heavy during the early morning hours on
Thursday. Snow intensity will decrease by late morning with
snowfall tapering off during the afternoon hours.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 AM EST FRIDAY
